title: How to Make French Toast with Peanut Butter and Bananas

steps.headline: Make at least one or two slices of French Toast.
steps.description: If you want to use packaged French toast from the store, that works, too. As a general rule of thumb, soak a slice of bread in some beaten eggs. Then place them in a griddle pan on the stove and cook them until each of the sides are cooked evenly but not burned. Make as many slices as you'd like, and spread them out on a plate.

steps.headline: Spread peanut butter all over both slices of the French toast.
steps.description: Be careful that you don't cut down far enough into the bread to slice it. Heat the peanut butter in a microwave for about ten seconds to soften it quickly to an almost runny appearance, much like some other restaurants. However, this appearance must be done to-taste.

steps.headline: Stack the two slices of French Toast covered with the peanut butter on top of each other.
Cut up a banana.
steps.description: Plantains work too and give the dish a Latin American flavor.

steps.headline: Place the banana slices on top of the peanut butter on one slice of French toast.
Stack another piece of French toast on top.
steps.description: Then enjoy! Cantaloupe and melon slices can also be added on the side.

text: Make at least one or two slices of French Toast. If you want to use packaged French toast from the store, that works, too. As a general rule of thumb, soak a slice of bread in some beaten eggs. Then place them in a griddle pan on the stove and cook them until each of the sides are cooked evenly but not burned. Make as many slices as you'd like, and spread them out on a plate. Spread peanut butter all over both slices of the French toast. Be careful that you don't cut down far enough into the bread to slice it. Heat the peanut butter in a microwave for about ten seconds to soften it quickly to an almost runny appearance, much like some other restaurants. However, this appearance must be done to-taste. Stack the two slices of French Toast covered with the peanut butter on top of each other.  Cut up a banana. Plantains work too and give the dish a Latin American flavor. Place the banana slices on top of the peanut butter on one slice of French toast.  Stack another piece of French toast on top. Then enjoy! Cantaloupe and melon slices can also be added on the side.
